page.title: 13HEALTH IN FRILSHAM
page.content: { Babies}born in the area are born at the Royal Berkshire Hospital in Reading. All classes are represented there. Very few mothers give birth at home. Antenatal clinics are in Newbury and Reading.{Medical care}is dispensed at Chieveley Health Centre. Patients at Frilsham and Marlston can be collected in the Centre's minibus which wil also deliver{prescriptions. Those who need special care or {hospitalisation}go to Newbury or Reading by hospital car or ambulance - free on the National Health Service. The{frail elderly}who can no longer cope on their own go to homes or sheltered housing in Thatcham. A {dental clinic}is held in the village hall but most dental care is in Newbury. The{dead}are buried in Frilsham or Marlston churchyards or are cremated at Reading or Oxford.
